Rescind.definition: to take back and make void [ ed its suspension of his license] 2
Rescind.origin: [Latin rescindere to cut loose, annul, from re- away, back + scindere to cut, split]

1.definition: to take back and make void [its suspension of his license]

2.definition: to abrogate (a contract or transaction) by mutual agreement, judicial decree, or unilateral declaration because of fraud, mistake, duress, misrepresentation, illegality, a breach, or another sufficient ground with both parties restored to their positions before the contract was made [denied that the other party had the right to the contract] compare,

3.definition: to make void by the same or by a superior authority [ a regulation]to rescind something (as a contract)
